text: Hi everyone! Could someone please have a look at a new package registration for KROME.jl? <https://github.com/JuliaRegistries/General/pull/29997|https://github.com/JuliaRegistries/General/pull/29997>? It seems to be blocked due to naming similarities, but since the package is a wrapper for the KROME library (<http://kromepackage.org/|http://kromepackage.org/>) I feel like it should really be named after it.

elements.text: Hi everyone! Could someone please have a look at a new package registration for KROME.jl?
? It seems to be blocked due to naming similarities, but since the package is a wrapper for the KROME library (
) I feel like it should really be named after it.

text: There are also some other blocking reasons mentioned, but I am not sure what they mean or if they just follow from the naming conflict

elements.text: There are also some other blocking reasons mentioned, but I am not sure what they mean or if they just follow from the naming conflict

text: Ah, thanks, I see it now. I think it's related to the fact that the build step requires python3 but the script apparently does not work with the used python3.6 (I only tested it with python3.8 so far). I'll try to fix that and re-register.

elements.text: Ah, thanks, I see it now. I think it's related to the fact that the build step requires python3 but the script apparently does not work with the used python3.6 (I only tested it with python3.8 so far). I'll try to fix that and re-register.

text: Is there anything I can do about the naming issue upfront?

elements.text: Is there anything I can do about the naming issue upfront?

text:
Nope, it's not `python3.6` . I just tried the command the failed for the registry CI
```python3 krome -interfacePy -interfaceC -unsafe -test=hello```
from <https://github.com/JuliaRegistries/General/pull/29997/checks?check_run_id=1892538820#step:6:114|here>, and it works. Googling the error message
```UnicodeDecodeError: 'ascii' codec can't decode byte 0xc2 in position 488: ordinal not in range(128)```
from <https://github.com/JuliaRegistries/General/pull/29997/checks?check_run_id=1892538820#step:6:111|here> seems to indicate that this is a problem when no locale is set (e.g., <https://stackoverflow.com/a/56108986/1329844|here> and <https://github.com/mroosmalen/nanosv/issues/45#issuecomment-672792713|here>). Have you encountered this problem before? It seems to be fixable by setting
```ENV LC_ALL=C.UTF-8```
in the Dockerfile, but I can also try to fix it locally

attachments.title: UnicodeDecodeError: 'ascii' codec can't decode byte 0xe2 in position 13: ordinal not in range(128)
attachments.text: I'm using NLTK to perform kmeans clustering on my text file in which each line is considered as a document. So for example, my text file is something like this: belong finger death punch <br>
